comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Presumably Louie ad Gyp are the same as in www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2422667831/

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: NYTimes article of 9/18/12 talks about an investigation into who was helping conceal Louie and Gyp in an apartment at 765 Woodward Avenue in Brooklyn. Apparently some associates rented 3 apartments and furniture for each and L and G were arrested in one of these hide outs. They came to Woodward Ave after they returned from the Catskills (Parksville) where they had been previously. The newspaper reports suggest that there were several special investigations going on at once because of articles in the newspaper suggesting that some police officers were suppressing evidence (letters), perhaps because they were somehow involved in the murder. As complicated as "The Sopranos"!

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: There is another Flickr photo of the building to the left side of this photo: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3512940334/

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3512940334/] TRYING TO FIND MEN WHO AIDED GUNMEN; Subpoenas Sent Out for Those Who Sold Furniture for Flats -Kramer's Activity Puzzling. September 18, 1912, Wednesday Justice Goff sitting as a Magistrate in charge of a John Doe inquiry, and Acting District Attorney Frank Moss continued their efforts yesterday to discover whether or not important evidence connected with the arrest of "Gyp the Blood" Horowitz and "Lefty Louie" Rosenberg had been suppressed by the police. Source: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D04E2D81630E233A... Looking at Google maps and street view, it looks like the building was demolished to make way for the elevated line.
